reviews.review_msg: Lectures were boring and hard to follow. Scribbled notes on a piece of paper that were illegible.

Simon is a good prof BUT he is super unorganized and likes to go off on tangents a lot. He doesn't make any lecture slides so it's often hard to go back and study. Lucky the class is fairly easy and readings are short

The material interested me, including both of the textbooks. But when 55 min feels like an eternity, something is wrong! The lecture slides felt incomplete and dry. Her expectations regarding exams or essays were non-existent. I love philosophy, but not enough to sit through these lectures.
Took philosophy 144 and felt it was taught in the least interesting way. It was quite difficult for a one hundred level course.
Clear lectures.  Tough term papers.  Personality galore.
She doesn't want to make ANYTHING easy! Be prepared to study like crazy. Her 100 level classes are more like 400 level!!!!!

Good course for any science major.  Papers are slightly tricky to write because the topics quite broad, but the midterm and final have no essays, and are easy if you have a good sense of logic.  For short answer questions, be sure you know and can restate the conclusions reached by each author and the punch lines of each of the readings.

Excellent Prof. Dr Mc is strict on attendance because assignments are based off of them. Her exams are extremely challenging, but if you have a genuine interest in the topic, you will do well. That is, if you enjoy philosophy of science, you will appreciate the difficulty of the content.

Pretty good B-Sci course for a Social Science student (or anyone), does not require any background in science. Gives notes and online recordings, but do NOT study off the notes - they are very fragmented and idiosyncratic. Beware of the second paper - essays are very technical in her class. Summarizes contemporary science much better than Sci 300.
great prof! cares about the students and the class. As with all phil classes, class will be hard if you cant write
Don't take Philosophy as an elective. It's really hard, and Jill's not the easiest marker either! AVOID, AVOID, AVOID PHILOSOPHY.
Lectures were quite dry and more confusing than the philosophical readings themselves. Paper topics were weirded kind of strangely, but ask her to explain in class and it makes a bit more sense.
A kind and enthusiastic instructor. Happy to talk to students outside of class who are seeking help. Course requirements are not particularly demanding.

Professor Lin was a great professor who was very nice. Most of the readings were easy to understand with a few exceptions, same with the lectures. The lectures felt very much like a large tutorial as there was a lot of group discussion. Grading's very clear as well and it's easy to pass the class or get a high mark if you put in the effort.
Absolutely the worst class I have ever taken in my life. This class was bane of my existence. Dont ever wanna have a single philosophical thought because of this course.

Here's a burn-style student review you could drop anywhere:


---

This professor could make rocket launches sound boring. Lectures are incoherent rambles, questions get shot down with sarcasm, and grading feels like rolling dice. Philosophy of science should challenge you to thinkâ€”here it just drains your will to care. Avoid at all costs.
Single handedly ruined my whole term. Very strict grader. Expects you to focus on her class to the detriment of other classes. Zero compassion and understanding for students

Super passionate about what she teaches. Even if youre not personally interested, her passion is infectious. Really cares that her students understand material and assignments. Quick to respond to emails and open to feedback about how the course content could be adjusted for future students. Great prof.

Fall19 in-person. Holly is an excellent lecturer! Top quality prof at SFU. Philosophy readings are hard to understand but shes able to explain concepts that would otherwise be hard to explain in words. You could tell that she is intelligent and able to communicate her thoughts very well. I really learned a lot attending her class. Loved the topic.

Holly is an amazing prof, super sweet and understanding. THIS CLASS IS NOT AN EASY BOOSTER. Definitely a lot of work involved, papers, final, and the course material as well can be difficult to grasp at times. The course overall is interesting and a good grade can be achieved through constantly studying and reviewing material.

Holly is super kind and helpful. This class has a lot of reading and some parts may be hard to understand without previous knowledge of physics. If you are looking for an easy credit, this class is not the one! Around 75% of the time, I had no clue what was going on, but with a solid amount of effort, I actually managed to do pretty well.

Probably the most boring class I've taken in my 3 years. She's a enthusiastic prof and is pretty nice, however the material is really boring which made it difficult to remain focused in class. Lectures were recorded, however its always best to go because her train of thought and organization of the lecture is chaotic.

No midterms but god the material is so boring. She takes a long time talking in lectures and throws in a bunch of additional details that you dont need to know. If youre trying to boost your grade I wouldnt recomend this cause the information is trash and not interesting at all.

Holly was an amazing professor! I'm not even a philosophy major, but I would most definitely take a class with her again. She genuinely cares about her students and wants you to do well. Lectures are also somewhat humorous. Great prof!

I never used my textbook. she summarizes everything for you and explains the concepts quite well. Go to the lectures! Notes are extremely helpful for assignments and final. No midterms and she gives you questions that are going to be on the final exam.   Assignments are not that hard. You are given clear instructions.

She does very well in engaging the class! I've never found science interesting, plus I've never taken a philosophy course so the two combined made me reluctant.  However she's very charismatic and knowledgable.  This course has actually made me interested in philosophy and the sciences, would highly recommend it.
Lectures are very well put together and the tutorials really compliment the course work. Highly recommend this class to any arts students looking for a not so science heavy science credit.

Worst class I have ever taken. Enrolled  to fill out a requirement thinking a 100 level course would be simple. THIS WAS HARDER THAN 3rd YEAR CLASSES! Testing is complex and lectures are confusing. Do not take this class!

she is the most terrible prof I have had in my life, she lowered my GPA so much that I could not transfer to the university that I wanted just because of her class grade. Useless and rude.definition of incomprehensible. When the average of class is 33 percent then there is something wrong with you or your course,not with the students.

Notes are great to follow along, usually OK in the beginning then steers off like a bottle rocket and leaves everyone thinking wtf (granted, philosophy has that slight tendency). Thank god her curriculum somewhat parallels that of wikipedia articles. Tests have a tendency to include inference rules and sentential logic even if not touched in course
